items.title: If you are voting in-person and your voting eligibility is being...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

If you are voting in-person and your voting eligibility is being challenged or you forgot your ID, you have the right to cast a provisional ballot. Provisional ballots ensure that every qualified and registered voter can cast a vote that will be counted. You will fill out an affidavit and receive a receipt with instructions on how to follow-up on your ballot status.

Report issues to 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

items.title: Know your rights. You have the right to vote free of...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Know your rights. You have the right to vote free of intimidation or interference. If you suspect voter intimidation:

✅ Prioritize your own safety
✅ Document the incident with as much detail as possible
✅ Report to 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA, your county clerk, and voting@aclu-co.org

...

Find your county clerk: https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/…/CountyClerkRosterWebsite.pdf

See MoreIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Today is Election Day! All ballots must be received by 7 P.M....
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Today is Election Day! All ballots must be received by 7 P.M. TODAY, November 3rd.

For assistance or to report issues call: 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or text 303-502-9038.

Find your polling location: https://justvotecolorado.org/

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Conozca sus derechos: tiene derecho a votar sin intimidación o...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Conozca sus derechos: tiene derecho a votar sin intimidación o interferencia. Si sospecha intimidación de votantes:

✅ Prioriza tu propia seguridad
✅ Documenta el incidente con el mayor detalle posible
✅ Informe al 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA, el secretario de su condado y vote@aclu-co.org.

...

https://bit.ly/3jwOr07

See MoreKnow your rights: you have the right to vote without intimidation or interference. If you suspect intimidation of voters: ✅ Prioritize your own safety ✅ Document the incident in as much detail as possible ✅ Report to 1-888-VE-Y-VOTE, County Secretary and vote@aclu-co.org. https://bit.ly/3jwOr07TranslatedIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: The election isn't over on Election night. Election results...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The election isn't over on Election night. Election results are final when every vote is counted. Results called on Election night are only projections. Each state has specific laws that govern the counting process procedures and timelines.

Mail ballots go through a rigorous screening process to ensure election integrity. This process should not be rushed or politicized. A complete and accurate count is more important than a fast ballot count.

Check with your state and county officials for real results. https://www.sos.state.co.us/voter/pages/pub/home.xhtml

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Es un delito federal intimidar, amenazar o obligar a otra...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Es un delito federal intimidar, amenazar o obligar a otra persona con el fin de interferir con el derecho de esa persona a votar o elegir a cierta persona. La intimidación de votantes puede ocurrir en cualquier lugar, no solo cerca de un lugar de votación. No importa dónde suceda, documente y reporte la intimidación de votantes a sus funcionarios electos locales: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 y llame al 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) o al 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA (1-888-839-8682)

It is a federal crime to intimidate, threaten, or force another person in order to interfere with that person's right to vote or elect a certain person. Voter bullying can happen anywhere, not just near a polling location. No matter where it happens, document and report voter intimidation to your local elected officials: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 and call 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTE (1-888-839-8682 ))TranslatedIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Election Day is tomorrow. Here are three things you can do to...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Election Day is tomorrow. Here are three things you can do to help others vote.
🗳️ Coloradans can turn in up to 10 ballots in a general election on behalf of others. Ballots must be returned to a drop box the same day they are collected. Take a video of your ballot delivery so the person you're helping can rest easy.
🗳️ Know your voting rights and share with others: https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/voting-rights/
🗳️ Share the voter protection hotline to report voter suppression: 1-866-OUR-VOTE and 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Election Day is tomorrow! Here are three things to do if you...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Election Day is tomorrow! Here are three things to do if you haven't voted yet:

🗳️Vote in-person: You can register the same day and receive voting assistance at a polling place near you.
🗳️Find your nearest ballot drop box, drive-through or in-person voting location at: https://justvotecolorado.org/.
🗳️Use the ACLU voter guide to help you navigate statewide ballot questions: aclu-co.org/voterguide

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: It is a federal crime to intimidate, threaten, or coerce another...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

It is a federal crime to intimidate, threaten, or coerce another person for the purpose of interfering with that person's right to vote or vote as they may choose. Voter intimidation can take place anywhere — not just near a polling location. No matter where it happens, document and report voter intimidation to your local elected officials: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 And call 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA (1-888-839-8682)

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: The tragedy of this pandemic is worsened if we fail to learn the...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The tragedy of this pandemic is worsened if we fail to learn the lessons COVID has taught us about a bloated and harmful carceral system that needlessly incarcerates thousands of Coloradans. We must act now to keep jail populations low and families together. Read the report: https://bit.ly/371MTZt

items.title: Just moved? First time voter? Coloradans can register to vote up...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Just moved? First time voter? Coloradans can register to vote up to and on Election Day. If you need to register to vote or update your voter registration information, you can still do so in-person at a Voter Service and Polling Center in your county.

Don't forget to bring one of 16 acceptable forms of ID, including Medicaid cards and utility bills: https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/elections/vote/acceptableForm…

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Black and white people engage in pretrial misconduct at equal...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Black and white people engage in pretrial misconduct at equal rates. Yet Colorado's risk assessment tools categorize Black people as "high risk" 50% more often. As a result, Black people are more likely to be incarcerated pretrial. End this racist system. Read more: https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

items.title: Ballot selfies? In Colorado, you have the right to take a...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Ballot selfies? In Colorado, you have the right to take a picture of your ballot, whether you have voted or not. It's your choice to share who you voted for or how you voted.

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Denver is threatening public health by arbitrarily designating...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Denver is threatening public health by arbitrarily designating public works cleanups without community support. Decisions about people experiencing homelessness should never be made without the input of people experiencing homelessness.

Story by Robert Davis Photos by Giles Clasen The ACLU of Colorado has notified the Denver City Attorney’s Office (CAO) that the City is violating the terms of the Lyall settlement and threatening public health by arbitrarily designating two former homeless camp sites for “regular public works cl

items.title: Risk assessment tools are used to decide who remains in jail....
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Risk assessment tools are used to decide who remains in jail. The stakes couldn't be higher. Yet our research shows that they're dangerous, ineffective and racist. We can't automate decisions around liberty and freedom. Read the ACLU letter released today: https://bit.ly/2G5RqyK

items.title: We must take action to bring our neighbors safely home or more...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

We must take action to bring our neighbors safely home or more people will die behind bars and in the community. Safe decarceration should be part of Governor Jared Polis's plan to protect public health. It's necessary and possible, here's how: https://acluco-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/…/aclu_decarceration…

https://www.denverpost.com/…/colorado-prison-inmate-dies-c…/

Four men incarcerated in Colorado’s prisons have died after contracting COVID-19.

denverpost.com

A fourth Colorado inmate has died after experiencing COVID-19 symptoms

Four men incarcerated in Colorado’s prisons have died after contracting COVID-19.Four men incarcerated in Colorado’s prisons have died after contracting COVID-19.

items.title: The harms of eviction run deep. That's why we're...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The harms of eviction run deep. That's why we're fighting alongside the No Eviction Without Representation campaign and housing justice advocates to challenge unjust evictions. With or without a global pandemic, fair access to housing is a legal right.

Boulder may not be an epicenter of COVID-19 infections, but the virus and economic fallout are upending lives all the same. Almost 20,000 Boulder residents have lost their jobs since March, and thousands of towns and cities across the country face similar circumstances. With moratoriums on evictions...

items.title: COVID-19 cases are on the rise in Colorado. Do your part by...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

COVID-19 cases are on the rise in Colorado. Do your part by filling out your ballot at home and returning it to a drop box. Keep in-person polls open for those who need it, like first-time voters, voters who need assistance, and your neighbors who work multiple jobs.

Find your nearest drop box and drive-through* voting locations: https://www.sos.state.co.us/pubs/elections/VIP.html

*Not available in all counties.

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Quarantine puppy ate your ballot? Whether your ballot was...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Quarantine puppy ate your ballot? Whether your ballot was damaged, or you made a mistake while voting at home, you have the right to a replacement ballot — as long as you haven't returned the damaged ballot. Contact your county clerk to get a replacement ballot or go vote in-person. Be sure to destroy your damaged ballot.
Contact your county clerk: https://www.sos.state.co.us/…/Re…/CountyElectionOffices.html
Find in-person voting location: https://justvotecolorado.org/

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info
